description:
The simple little country girl Papri has a problem: her boyfriend Minto seems to show signs of interest towards another little girl, Cocco. Papri has to win his love back! The only way she can achieve that is by collecting flower bouquets, presenting them to Minto as a token of her feelings and gradually making him forget the other girl.

Girl's Garden is Yuji Naka's debut and an early precursor of games with dating gameplay mechanics. Papri has to move through a confined top-down area, collecting flowers on the way. After having collected ten flowers, Papri can enter her boyfriend's house, completing a round and advancing to the next one, with the same goal but increased difficulty. Flowers must be picked up at full blossom; catching them too early will have no effect, while collecting wilted flowers will make Papri lose half of her bouquet.

Papri's health is called "love" in the game, and is represented by hearts. She loses a heart if she falls into water or if a bear comes too close to her. Bears are roaming the area and can be temporarily distracted by dropping honey pots on the ground. Bees act as allies and will supply Papri with honey and bonus items that increase the score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Round completed! Field covered by flowers! The boyfriend likes you again!.. ... ... real love should come naturally, in my opinion :()
New round. More bonus items, different flowers, harder to play
Across the bridge. Note a fully blossomed flower to the North-East
Don't fall into the water! You'll lose a heart...

title: Girl's Garden

description:
Golgo 13 is a scrolling shooter based on the manga of the same name, putting the player in control of its main character, the assassin Duke Togo. In this adaptation, however, the protagonist's goal is, on the contrary, to rescue people. The screen scrolls horizontally, displaying Duke on a car that is moving along the road, trying to keep up with a moving train on top of the screen. The player can move the car left and right, aligning it with the train's cars.

The goal is to shoot the train's windows, letting the people trapped inside run out. The player controls a crosshair, moving it in all directions, and presses the fire button to shoot. Between the player-controlled character and the train there is another track with a never-ending cargo train on it; tall cars of this train will not only block the crosshair's path, but also bounce the bullets back at Duke, hurting him. In later stages trucks will appear on the road and helicopters will shoot missiles at Duke.

sample_screenshots.caption: First stage. Look, I shot a window and now that guy is free!
The truck just hit me. I lost a life

title: Golgo 13

description: Orguss is a horizontally-scrolling shoot-em-up based on the anime series of the same name. The inhabitants of Terram has constructed a terrifying weapon that can destroy space-time. The player character, piloting the Orguss craft, has 2:30 minutes to get to the weapon and deactivate it. This is done by flying either in the native ship form, or transforming into the powerful mecha Orgroid. The mecha shoots repeatedly if the player presses the fire button, while the ship's gun has to be fire separately for each shot. However, when the protagonist is in mecha form the screen scrolls slower, preventing the player from getting to the weapon in time. Enemies include hostile craft and stationary turrets on the ground. There are no power-ups of any kind, and the only stage of the game repeats itself after completion with increased difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: The final part of the stage

title: Orguss

description: Sega's first video pinball game. Standard pinball simulation, except for the moving bumper. For one or two players. Has four flippers (two big, two small). Get bonus points from "drop targets" and "kicker holes" and bonus balls for high scores.

sample_screenshots.caption: A game of Pinball in progress

title: Sega Flipper

description: A racing game with safari backgrounds and the added challenging of avoiding wild animals crossing the track. You must reach each checkpoint in the time allowed. You also risk running out of fuel and can refuel at petrol pumps(at the expense of your precious time of course). The background music seems to be derived from Henry Mancini's "Baby Elephant Walk"(1961).
title: Safari Race

description:
A martial arts, multi-level platformer. As martial-artist "Dragon Wang", you kick and jump-kick your way past martial-arts baddies, to rescue your girl.

You must collect keys by defeating mid-level bosses, to open doors and progress through the stage.

sample_screenshots.caption: Normal enemies. But a bit too many.

title: Dragon Wang

description: You have an top-down view of each golf hole, including a zoom-in of the green. A bar along the top shows a crude animation of the golfer and necessary variables like wind, club-type, par, shots, distance from hole etc.
title: Champion Golf

description:
In this version of billiards, you progress to the each next level by sinking all the other balls with a red ball. The billiard tables are like miniature golf greens.

If you break open the yellow ball, sometimes a yellow "Flicky" bird is released (Sega released Flicky in 1984).
title: Champion Billiards

description: Video tennis to be played against the computer or a friend. First player to win six games wins the set. Player A is a blue silhouette, while Player B is crimson. The melody played at the beginning of the match is that of "Windy" by The Association (1967).
title: Champion Tennis

description: This is a standard, top-down Mahjong title. You can play against the computer or a friend. The game came with a plastic screen to stick to your TV screen in two-player mode, to hide your opponent's tiles.
title: Home Mahjong

description:
This version of the popular board game(also known as Reversi) was first built into Tsukuda Original's Othello Multivision. It was reprogrammed and re-released in cartridge form for the SG-1000.

The game involves placing discs of your colour on a grid-board, and trying to turn your opponent's discs to your own colour.
title: Othello

description:
The game plays like a combination of the Namco games Rally X and Pac-Man and a follow-on from Sega's 1979 game Head-On.

As the green car Pacar, you consume dots like Pac-Man, and dodge red and blue cars instead of ghosts. Like Pac-Man, you collect "power dots" for invincibility and progress through levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Just a simple title screen. Notice there's also keyboard control for those that own a Sega SC-3000 computer.
The second stage has a different layout.
Starting out. Players control the green car.
Large pellets appear occasionally and picking one up makes you turn pink temporarily. While this is in effect, you can destroy enemies by crashing onto them and earn extra points.

title: Pacar

description: A video game version of Pachinko, a mechanical, arcade pinball game from Japan. This particular game is actually quite rare as it was recalled due to a bug. It was replaced with Pachinko II.

sample_screenshots.caption: Just a simple title screen. Also, your high score is displayed here.

title: Pachinko

description: This was released as a replacement for the buggy, recalled SG-1000 game Pachinko. It's another video game version of the mechanical, arcade pinball game from Japan.
title: Pachinko II

description:
Space Slalom has the look of a scrolling shooter, but it's actually a "space-sports" game - that is, a ski slalom in space.

You move your ship between the "flags"(actually coloured stars) and must also avoid obstacles. Your aim is to complete each course as quickly as possible.
title: Space Slalom

description: A side-scrolling, horse racing game with pixelated graphics. You race against a maximum of 7 other horses and must win multiple races.
title: Challenge Derby

description:
This is basically an SG-1000 version of the popular Sega arcade game Hang On, from earlier in the year. Has a decent re-arrangement of the arcade game's theme music. So you race against the clock to reach each checkpoint in each course.

While you appear to be racing against other motorbikes, there is no keeping track of your position. The other bikes are just for you to dodge. The sections of the course have different background - e.g green fields, yellow desert, blue water, mountains, rock mesas, skyscraper buildings.
title: Hang On II

description: A vertical, player-controlled scrolling game where you control a tank. You move your tank along deserts, fields, roads and pavements, shooting air and land opponents. There are end of level bosses i.e bases with gun turrets.
title: Super Tank

description: This is a 2-player golfing game, licensed from Ayako Okamoto, who was a popular female Japanese golfer - you can play as either a female or male golfer. The main view is a behind, third-person view and in a side bar is a top-down map of the tee. Other than that, the usual stats like par & distance from hole apply.
title: Okamoto Ayako no Match Play Golf

description: A version of the Japanese tile matching board game. This version is for three players.
title: Sannin Mahjong

description: This is a third-person, behind-view space shooter, heavily inspired by Star Wars. You control a Fighter resembling the X-wing and destroy enemy ships that look quite a lot like TIE Fighters. Then you enter an enemy base and fly along a trench (like in Star Wars!)
title: Space Mountain

description: Space Armor is a vertically scrolling space shooter. You have a gun and bomb attack like Xevious, and must fly in space or over planets, shooting aliens.
title: Space Armor

description:
Loretta no Shouzou or Loretta's Portrait is an adventure game. In this title you play as Sherlock Holmes at the end of the 19th century who has agreed to find the portrait stolen from the art gallery. Basic gameplay is based around choosing appropriate commands such as Look, Take, Talk, Examine and so on, a separate menu also summons up the verbs related to movement such as Move or Enter. Despite those commands being in English, the majority of game text is in Japanese only, as the game was not released anywhere else.

To solve the case you are free to explore the city of London which is presented as a grid map with 34 square in total, each of whose could be visited by a persistent investigator. To advance the plot you'll have to search the locations for clues, collect them in your inventory and speak with the characters by asking them about things you have learned so far. You can highlight objects and people using a cursor to get descriptions from Holmes which makes Loretta no Shouzuo somewhat a point'n'click title. Besides the city map, there are also a couple of maze-like locations that needs to be explored on their own.

sample_screenshots.caption: Someone came to visit the detective.
We're in London, in case you didn't know.

title: Loretta no Shōzō: Sherlock Holmes

description:
Jet Paco & Jet Puri is a homebrew 2D platform game that is a reworked and an expanded version of the 2015 homebrew NES game Jet-Paco by the same developer. The game is largely identical to the NES version, but this is the first release of the game for the SG-1000 platform. A major difference is the addition of a third mission called Mission C available on the title screen.

Also new is that the player can now choose a new character, Jet Puri, in addition to Jet Paco as the original protagonist. The character selection is also done on the title screen. The character Jet Puri was previously introduced through a game in the 2017 NES release Mojon Twins Gran Sabiduría: 31 in 1 Real Games, but unlike that game she wears clothes in this release. The characters are described as siblings: Paco and Puri Rebollez.
title: Jet Paco & Jet Puri

description:
Wonder Boy on the SG-1000 is more of a de-make of the game released in the Arcades and various other platforms. The game features only five levels of one stage each. The design of the levels is different and several enemy types, bosses and bonuses are missing from the game entirely, including the game's iconic skate board and the invincibility fairy.

The core gameplay remains intact with the player controlling Tom-Tom through various side-scrolling levels while avoiding or attacking enemies with a hatchet. Points are scored by collecting fruit. Tom-Tom has limited lives to reach it al the way to the final level.
title: Wonder Boy
